East Africa / Uganda   China                  Request More Information    Apply to Wagner                                      About Us   The Alumni in Performance Measurement and Management Group is made up of local public and nonprofit professionals who are working on issues of performance measurement and management.   Attend our bi-monthly colloquiums to share best practices and challenges with industry professionals. Participate in discussion groups and connect with expert guest speakers.   Listserv   Join our contact list by e-mailing:     wagner.alumni@nyu.edu                   Contacts   Leader: Patrick Germain , MPA 2008                                  Group Events     01.30.2014 - NYU Wagner Alumni Happy Hour in NYC                                                                                      © NYU Wagner   295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604   212.998.7400   Copyright and Fair Use   Contact Us   Sitemap   New York University

Performance Measurement and Management for Public, Nonprofit, and Health Care Organizations | NYU Wagner                                    Jump to navigation                                                             Performance Measurement and Management for Public, Nonprofit, and Health Care Organizations   PADM-GP.2170, 3 points. Semester: Spring, Fall       Courses         Description |    Syllabi |    Evaluations           All public and not-for-profit organizations must assemble and report information on their performance. The need for performance measures goes beyond legal and regulatory requirements. To provide services effectively and efficiently, managers need information to make decisions. This course focuses on what performance measures are needed, how they should be created and what forms of communication are most effective.    Prerequisites: CORE-GP.1020                     Semester     Instructor     Syllabus Link         Fall 2014 Patrick Germain Syllabus  Spring 2014 Gordon J. Campbell Syllabus  Spring 2014 Gordon J.
